verses.verse: Hear<WH8085> you now<WH4994> what<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> said;<WH559> Arise,<WH6965> contend<WH7378> you before<WH854> the mountains,<WH2022> and let the hills<WH1389> hear<WH8085> your voice.<WH6963>

Hear<WH8085> you, O mountains,<WH2022> the LORD's<WH3068> controversy,<WH7379> and you strong<WH386> foundations<WH4146> of the earth:<WH776> for the LORD<WH3068> has a controversy<WH7379> with his people,<WH5971> and he will plead<WH3198> with Israel.<WH3478>
O my people,<WH5971> what<WH4100> have I done<WH6213> to you? and wherein<WH4100> have I wearied<WH3811> you? testify<WH6030> against me.

For I brought<WH5927> you up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and redeemed<WH6299> you out of the house<WH1004> of servants;<WH5650> and I sent<WH7971> before<WH6440> you Moses,<WH4872> Aaron,<WH175> and Miriam.<WH4813>

O my people,<WH5971> remember<WH2142> now<WH4994> what<WH4100> Balak<WH1111> king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> consulted,<WH3289> and what<WH4100> Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> answered<WH6030> him from Shittim<WH7851> to Gilgal;<WH1537> that you may know<WH3045> the righteousness<WH6666> of the LORD.<WH3068>

With which<WH4100> shall I come<WH6923> before<WH6924> the LORD,<WH3068> and bow<WH3721> myself before the high<WH4791> God?<WH430> shall I come<WH6923> before<WH6924> him with burnt<WH5930> offerings, with calves<WH5695> of a year<WH8141> old?<WH1121>

Will the LORD<WH3068> be pleased<WH7521> with thousands<WH505> of rams,<WH352> or with ten<WH7233> thousands<WH7233> of rivers<WH5158> of oil?<WH8081> shall I give<WH5414> my firstborn<WH1060> for my transgression,<WH6588> the fruit<WH6529> of my body<WH990> for the sin<WH2403> of my soul?<WH5315>

He has showed<WH5046> you, O man,<WH120> what<WH4100> is good;<WH2896> and what<WH4100> does the LORD<WH3068> require<WH1875> of you, but to do<WH6213> justly,<WH4941> and to love<WH160> mercy,<WH2617> and to walk<WH3212> humbly<WH6800> with your God?<WH430>

The LORD's<WH3068> voice<WH6963> cries<WH7121> to the city,<WH5892> and the man of wisdom<WH8454> shall see<WH7200> your name:<WH8034> hear<WH8085> you the rod,<WH4294> and who<WH4310> has appointed<WH3259> it.
Are there yet<WH5750> the treasures<WH214> of wickedness<WH7562> in the house<WH1004> of the wicked,<WH7563> and the scant<WH7332> measure<WH374> that is abominable?<WH2194>
Shall I count them pure<WH2135> with the wicked<WH7562> balances,<WH3976> and with the bag<WH3599> of deceitful<WH4820> weights?<WH68>

For the rich<WH6223> men thereof are full<WH4390> of violence,<WH2555> and the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof have spoken<WH1696> lies,<WH8267> and their tongue<WH3956> is deceitful<WH7423> in their mouth.<WH6310>
Therefore also<WH1571> will I make you sick<WH2470> in smiting<WH5221> you, in making you desolate<WH8074> because<WH5921> of your sins.<WH2403>

You shall eat,<WH398> but not be satisfied;<WH7646> and your casting<WH3445> down shall be in the middle<WH7130> of you; and you shall take<WH5253> hold,<WH5253> but shall not deliver;<WH6403> and that which<WH834> you deliver<WH6403> will I give<WH5414> up to the sword.<WH2719>

You shall sow,<WH2232> but you shall not reap;<WH7114> you shall tread<WH1869> the olives,<WH2132> but you shall not anoint<WH5480> you with oil;<WH8081> and sweet<WH8492> wine,<WH8492> but shall not drink<WH8354> wine.<WH3196>

For the statutes<WH2708> of Omri<WH6018> are kept,<WH8104> and all<WH3605> the works<WH4639> of the house<WH1004> of Ahab,<WH256> and you walk<WH3212> in their counsels;<WH4156> that I should make<WH5414> you a desolation,<WH8047> and the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof an hissing:<WH8322> therefore you shall bear<WH5375> the reproach<WH2781> of my people.<WH5971>
